casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
James Michael DONOVAN, Appellant. No. ED 106382 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. Filed: February 13, 2019 ATTORNEYS FOR APPELLANT: Jedd C. Schneider, 1000 West Nifong Blvd., Building 7, Suite 1000, Columbia, MO 65203. ATTORNEYS FOR RESPONDENT: Eric Schmitt, Attorney General, Robert J. Bartholomew, Jr., Asst. Attorney General, P. O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102-0899. Before Philip M. Hess, P.J. and Robert G. Dowd, Jr. and Mary K. Hoff, JJ.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

James Donovan appeals from the judgment entered on his convictions after a jury trial for endangering a correctional employee and damaging jail property. There was no clear, evident or obvious error, nor grounds to believe a manifest injustice occurred, and plain error review is not warranted. We affirm.

An opinion would have no precedential value nor serve any jurisprudential purpose. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
